symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.description: Elevation of body temperature above 98.6°F (37°C).
symptoms.advice: Rest, stay hydrated, wear light clothes. Use cool water sponges if high.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If temperature exceeds 103°F or lasts more than 3 days.

symptoms.name: Cough
symptoms.description: Reflex action to clear your airways of mucus and irritants.
symptoms.advice: Stay hydrated, use honey/tea, steam inhalation.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If lasting more than 3 weeks or accompanied by high fever.

symptoms.name: Headache
symptoms.description: Pain or discomfort in the head or face region.
symptoms.advice: Rest in a dark room, hydration, stress management.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If accompanied by vomiting, fever, or neck stiffness.

symptoms.name: Stomach Pain
symptoms.description: Pain from inside the abdomen or the outer muscle wall.
symptoms.advice: Avoid solid food for a few hours, sip water, use a heating pad.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If pain is sharp, located in lower right side, or persists over 24 hours.

symptoms.name: Diarrhea
symptoms.description: Loose, watery stools occurring more than three times a day.
symptoms.advice: Drink ORS (Nimkol) to prevent dehydration. Eat bananas, rice, toast.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If signs of dehydration appear or lasts >2 days (adults) or >24hrs (kids).

symptoms.name: Vomiting
symptoms.description: Forceful expulsion of stomach contents through the mouth.
symptoms.advice: Stop eating. Sip small amounts of ORS or water/ginger tea.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If vomiting lasts more than 1 day or signs of dehydration occur.

symptoms.name: Chest Pain
symptoms.description: Discomfort or pain anywhere in the front of the body between neck and upper abdomen.
symptoms.advice: Sit down and rest immediately. Loosen tight clothing.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: IMMEDIATELY call 1122 or go to ER if heart attack is suspected.

symptoms.name: Shortness of Breath
symptoms.description: Feeling that you cannot get enough air into your lungs.
symptoms.advice: Sit upright, try to relax. Use inhaler if prescribed.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: Immediately if sudden or severe.

symptoms.name: Sore Throat
symptoms.description: Pain, scratchiness or irritation of the throat that often worsens when you swallow.
symptoms.advice: Salt water gargles, warm fluids, lozenges.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If accompanied by rash or fever >101°F.

symptoms.name: Skin Rash
symptoms.description: Change in the texture or color of your skin.
symptoms.advice: Keep area clean/dry. Avoid scratching. Apply calamine lotion.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If rash is infected, painful, or allergic reaction is suspected.

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.description: Feeling of constant tiredness or weakness.
symptoms.advice: Sleep hygiene, proper nutrition, hydration.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If it persists for weeks despite rest.

symptoms.name: Dizziness
symptoms.description: A sensation of spinning around and losing one's balance.
symptoms.advice: Sit or lie down immediately. Drink water.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If recurrent or accompanied by hearing loss/ringing.

symptoms.name: Back Pain
symptoms.description: Physical discomfort occurring anywhere on the spine or back.
symptoms.advice: Maintain posture, light stretching, hot/cold packs.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If pain follows a fall or causes leg weakness.

symptoms.name: Joint Pain
symptoms.description: Discomfort, aches, and soreness in any of the body’s joints.
symptoms.advice: Rest, ice packs (acute) or heat (chronic), gentle movement.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If joint is immobile or pain is severe.

symptoms.name: Toothache
symptoms.description: Pain in or around a tooth.
symptoms.advice: Clove oil, warm salt water rinse, avoid cold/hot foods.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: See a dentist as soon as possible.

symptoms.name: Earache
symptoms.description: Pain in the inner or outer ear.
symptoms.advice: Warm compress, keep ear dry. Do not insert objects.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If pain is severe or lasts >2 days.

symptoms.name: Dehydration
symptoms.description: Condition caused by the loss of too much fluid from the body.
symptoms.advice: Drink ORS (Nimkol) frequently, sip plain water.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: Immediately for children or elderly.

symptoms.name: Palpitations
symptoms.description: Feelings of having a fast-beating, fluttering or pounding heart.
symptoms.advice: Sit down, practice deep breathing, avoid caffeine.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If history of heart disease or frequent episodes.

symptoms.name: Anxiety
symptoms.description: Intense, excessive and persistent worry and fear.
symptoms.advice: Deep breathing (4-7-8 technique), grounding exercises.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If affecting daily life or sleep.

symptoms.name: Eye Redness/Pain
symptoms.description: Redness, itching, or pain in the eyes.
symptoms.advice: Wash with clean water, use cold compress, avoid touching.
symptoms.when_to_seek_help: If caused by chemical splash or foreign object.

conditions.name: Dengue Fever
conditions.description: Viral infection spread by mosquitoes common in Pakistan.
conditions.treatment: Supportive care, hydration (ORS/juices), Paracetamol. AVOID Aspirin/Brufen.
conditions.prevention: Remove standing water, use mosquito repellent.

conditions.name: Malaria
conditions.description: Life-threatening disease caused by parasites transmitted by mosquitoes.
conditions.treatment: Antimalarial medication (requires prescription after blood test).

conditions.name: Diabetes Type 2
conditions.description: Chronic condition affecting how the body processes blood sugar.
conditions.prevention: Healthy diet, weight maintenance, regular exercise.

conditions.name: Hypertension
conditions.description: Long-term force of blood against artery walls is high.
conditions.prevention: Low salt diet, exercise, stress reduction.

conditions.name: Typhoid Fever
conditions.description: Bacterial infection caused by Salmonella typhi.

conditions.name: Gastroenteritis
conditions.description: Inflammation of the lining of the intestines.

conditions.name: Asthma
conditions.description: Airways narrow and swell and may produce extra mucus.

conditions.name: Hepatitis A/E
conditions.description: Viral liver infection usually spread through ingestion.
conditions.treatment: Rest, hydration, low-fat diet. Usually self-limiting.

conditions.name: Hepatitis B/C
conditions.description: Viral infection attacking the liver, spread via blood/fluids.

conditions.name: Pneumonia
conditions.description: Infection that inflames air sacs in one or both lungs.

conditions.name: Scabies
conditions.description: Itchy skin condition caused by a burrowing mite.
conditions.treatment: Permethrin cream, washing clothes in hot water.
conditions.prevention: Avoid direct contact with infected persons.

conditions.name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
conditions.description: Infection in any part of the urinary system.

conditions.name: Heatstroke
conditions.description: Condition caused by your body overheating.
conditions.treatment: Emergency cooling, move to shade, remove excess clothes.

conditions.name: Anemia
conditions.description: Lack of enough healthy red blood cells.

first_aid.name: Burns
first_aid.description: Tissue damage from heat, chemicals, or electricity.
steps: Run cool (not cold) tap water for 10-20 mins
warnings: Do NOT apply toothpaste or butter
first_aid.when_to_call_emergency: If burn is large, on face/hands/genitals, or electrical.

first_aid.name: Cuts and Bleeding
steps: Apply direct pressure with clean cloth
Clean with water once bleeding stops
first_aid.when_to_call_emergency: If bleeding doesn't stop after 10 mins pressure or spurts blood.

first_aid.name: Choking
warnings: Do not offer water while choking
first_aid.when_to_call_emergency: If person becomes unconscious or cannot breathe.

first_aid.name: Snake Bite
first_aid.when_to_call_emergency: IMMEDIATELY. Transport to hospital with anti-venom.

first_aid.name: Heart Attack
first_aid.description: Blockage of blood flow to the heart.
warnings: Do not drive yourself to hospital

first_aid.name: Heat Stroke
warnings: Do not give fluids if unconscious
first_aid.when_to_call_emergency: If patient is confused, unconscious, or hot/dry skin.

first_aid.name: Fracture
warnings: Do not try to realign the bone
first_aid.when_to_call_emergency: If bone is protruding (open fracture) or limb is pale/cold.

first_aid.name: Electric Shock
steps: Separate person from source using non-conductive object (wood)
warnings: Do not touch person until power is off
first_aid.when_to_call_emergency: Always, to check for internal damage.

first_aid.name: Dog Bite
first_aid.description: Bite from a dog, potential rabies risk.
steps: Wash wound with soap and running water for 15 minutes
first_aid.when_to_call_emergency: Go to hospital for Rabies Vaccine (IG/Vaccine) immediately.

first_aid.name: Seizure
first_aid.description: Uncontrolled electrical disturbance in the brain.
steps: Turn to side after jerking stops
warnings: Do NOT put anything in mouth
first_aid.when_to_call_emergency: If seizure lasts >5 mins or person is pregnant/injured.

medications.name: Paracetamol (Panadol/Calpol)
warnings: Be careful with other cold meds containing paracetamol.

medications.name: Ibuprofen (Brufen)
warnings: Avoid if you have Dengue suspicion or stomach ulcers.

medications.name: Aspirin (Disprin/Loprin)
warnings: Do NOT give to children under 16 (Reye's Syndrome risk).

medications.name: ORS (Nimkol/Pedialyte)
medications.dosage_info: Dissolve 1 sachet in 1 liter boiled water. Drink freely.

medications.name: Diclofenac (Voltral/Dicloran)
medications.uses: Severe joint pain, kidney stones, muscle pain.

medications.name: Amoxicillin (Amoxil/Augmentin)
warnings: Do not use if allergic to Penicillin.

medications.name: Oral Rehydration Salts (ORS)
warnings: Mix with correct amount of water.

medications.name: Mebendazole (Vermox)
warnings: Treat whole family if threadworms found.

preventive_care.name: Hand Hygiene
preventive_care.description: Washing hands with soap to prevent disease spread.

preventive_care.name: Water Safety
preventive_care.description: Ensuring drinking water is free of pathogens.
recommendations: Boil water for 1 min rolling boil

preventive_care.name: Vaccination (EPI)
preventive_care.frequency: As per EPI schedule (Birth to 15 months)
